body:
EDIT: missed the slider requirement. My first attempt fulfilled that, but involved changing the underlying library, so it would be a significant code change. Additionally, it wasn't a great solution because using arrow keys would shift it. Maybe some CSS magic could help; I'll leave the below stuff in case it helps.

![out](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14809320/155832262-3882601e-86d0-4142-878c-f76456bdbfe6.gif)

I tried [adding left and right padding](https://github.com/gerardrbentley/streamlit/commit/ffcc2766249e02de2e565993b5ea005f861eca91) to the Track for react-range and I think it's a straightforward solution.

```js
Track: {
  style: {
    paddingBottom: 0,
    paddingLeft: spacing.halfSmFont,
    paddingRight: spacing.halfSmFont,
    paddingTop: spacing.twoThirdsSmFont,
  },
},
```

![out4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14809320/155828958-fbeae8dd-dffe-41cc-859f-a9ec22616758.gif)

This solution generates a defect where the left-most endpoint jitters on hover. My proposed solution for that if the padding works: [check if the value is at the minimum](https://github.com/gerardrbentley/streamlit/commit/0eaff3e9860a8de6bab4a8a40e20fc73ce553767) in addition to if the elements are swapped

![out5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14809320/155829041-b9c191e5-9ac1-4b72-bb41-1203621b29db.gif)

Let me know if this seems off base; I figure there should be approval and updated snapshot testing before moving anything forward. Cheers!

issue.title: Papercuts: `st.selectBox`, `st.expander`, and `st.spinner`

issue.title: Papercut: Fix alignment on slider knob

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## üìö Context

This PR fixes an issue with the alignment of the `st.slider` knob. It resorts on a _hacky_ CSS technique to make it work, which causes some value differences with our existing e2e tests. The purpose of this PR is to determine whether we can update the e2e tests to reflect these new values, or if this technique is also changing other underlying behavior from the slider and therefore it might need to be handled differently.

- What kind of change does this PR introduce?

  - [ ] Bugfix
  - [ ] Feature
  - [ ] Refactoring
  - [x] Other, please describe: Visual Adjustments

## üß† Description of Changes

### Fix alignment for `st.slider` knob

  - [ ] This is a breaking API change
  - [x] This is a visible (user-facing) change

**Revised:**

![Screen Shot 2022-05-30 at 3 24 43 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34423371/171046202-c92cbfd2-05a8-4c61-8c1f-a36ef69cf1a1.png)

![Screen Shot 2022-05-30 at 3 24 51 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34423371/171046206-e49af327-3c16-483f-8d84-3408457e12e6.png)

**Current:**
![Screen Shot 2022-05-30 at 3 23 29 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34423371/171046154-fa4eb9e4-4ab1-4954-ae84-f7331176661b.png)

![Screen Shot 2022-05-30 at 3 23 37 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34423371/171046156-e021eb76-01a4-415f-a700-073e789c029e.png)

## üß™ Testing Done

- [x] Screenshots included
- [ ] Added/Updated unit tests
- [ ] Added/Updated e2e tests

## üåê References

- **Issue**: Closes #4284 

---

issue.title: Make slider thumbs not overshoot the track

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

Make slider thumbs not overshoot the track. (I found a really nice way of doing this!)

Also: this improves the animation for showing the min/max labels, and makes them show on focus-visible as well for better a11y.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)
Closes #4284

## Testing Plan

- ~~Explanation of why no additional tests are needed~~
- [x] Unit Tests (JS and/or Python) -- This code path is well-tested. Just updated existing tests.
- [x] E2E Tests -- This code path is already well-tested. No additional tests implemented.
- ~~Any manual testing needed?~~
